# Overview

\begin{itemize}
  \item A \textbf{2000-word} critical review of a journal article that uses one of the methods covered in the module
  \vspace{0.2cm}
  \item A link to a list of suggested journal articles can be found on Moodle (or your own choice approved by the module convenor)
  \vspace{0.2cm}
  \item Consider the following in your review:
  \vspace{0.1cm}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item What is the research process: Research question, theory, concepts, measurement, approach to explanation?
    \item How appropriate was the method? How well was it implemented? What other methods could have been used?
  \end{itemize}
  \vspace{0.2cm}
  \item Similar to our weekly seminar discussions
\end{itemize}

# Questions to ask: On the process

\begin{itemize}
  \item What ontology and epistemology underpinned the research? Was the research question and method consistent with the underlying philosophy?
  \vspace{0.3cm}
  \item How clear was the research question? Did the author(s) answer the question? Was it a "good" question?
  \vspace{0.3cm}
  \item How effectively was existing literature critically analysed and evaluated? Was it clear how the research would contribute to or challenge previous research?
  \vspace{0.3cm}
  \item What were the theoretical assumptions? Were these assumptions sound? Were the concepts used in the theory clearly defined?
\end{itemize}

# Questions to ask: On research methods

\begin{itemize}
  \item What method was used? How effective was the method for tackling the topic? How well was the method implemented?
  \vspace{0.4cm}
  \item What limitations were there to the method? What other methods could have been used?
  \vspace{0.4cm}
  \item What would you have done differently? What additional research could be conducted?
\end{itemize}

# When you submit

\begin{itemize}
  \item Attach the essay coversheet
  \item Enter your student ID in the field of Submission Title
  \item Submit your work by \textbf{Midday, 25 November 2024}
\end{itemize}
